phases.title: Fix Kanban filtering logic to prioritize active work over history
phases.content:
In KanbanBoard.tsx, modify the column filtering logic (around line 313-334) to check if an issue has active work with a non-completed status BEFORE excluding it based on completed history.

The current logic:
1. Excludes if in completedIssueNumbers
2. Then checks activeWork

The fix:
1. Check activeWork first
2. If activeWork exists with non-completed status, use that for column placement
3. Only fall back to completed exclusion if no active work exists

Specifically, change the filter to:
- If issue has activeWork with status != 'completed', use statusToColumn to place it
- Only exclude from non-completed columns if issue has NO activeWork entry
verification: Issue with 'reviewing' status in activeWork appears in Review column
Issue in completed history but with activeWork 'executing' appears in Execute column
Completed column still shows historical items correctly
